opinion.court: Supreme Court of the United States
opinion.case_name: Ward M. Miller v. Robert A. Haines, Director, Etc.

opinion:
389 U.S. 582

88 S.Ct. 694

19 L.Ed.2d 782

Ward M. MILLER
v.
Robert A. HAINES, Director, etc., et al.

No. 840.

Supreme Court of the United States

October Term, 1967.

January 15, 1968

Rehearing Denied March 4, 1968.

See 390 U.S. 975, 88 S.Ct. 1027.

Freeman T. Eagleson, Jr., for appellant.

William B. Saxbe, Atty. Gen. of Ohio, Winifred A. Dunton, Asst. Atty. Gen., and Charles S. Lopeman, for appellees.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion to dismiss is granted and the appeal is dismissed for want of a substantial federal question.

2

Mr. Justice DOUGLAS is of the opinion that probable jurisdiction should be noted.
